[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: InitPackage::execute()] [Path Traversal] Can an attacker supply a malicious package_dir path containing '../' sequences to write Move.toml files outside the intended directory, potentially overwriting critical system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: InitPackage::execute()] [Dependency Injection] Can an attacker manipulate the framework_git_rev parameter to point to a malicious fork of aptos-framework containing backdoored Move code that gets included in all initialized packages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: InitPackage::execute()] [Local Framework Poisoning] If framework_local_dir is specified, can an attacker provide a path to a compromised local framework directory containing malicious Move modules that bypass security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: FrameworkPackageArgs::init_move_dir()] [File Overwrite] Does the check_if_file_exists validation properly prevent overwriting existing Move.toml files, or can prompt_options bypass allow accidental/malicious overwrites of critical package configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: InitPackage::execute()] [Template Injection] When using Template::HelloBlockchain, can the hardcoded HELLO_BLOCKCHAIN_EXAMPLE contain injection vulnerabilities or outdated security practices that get propagated to new projects? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: FrameworkPackageArgs::init_move_dir()] [Manifest Serialization] Can malformed addresses in the manifest cause toml::to_string_pretty to produce invalid TOML that breaks package builds or introduces parsing vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: CompilePackage::execute()] [Bytecode Version Mismatch] Can fix_bytecode_version produce bytecode versions incompatible with the target blockchain, allowing attackers to deploy modules that execute differently than intended? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: CompilePackage::execute()] [Metadata Extraction] When save_metadata is true, can pack.extract_metadata_and_save() be exploited to overwrite critical build artifacts or inject malicious metadata into the package? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScript::compile_script()] [Script Count Validation] If a package contains zero scripts or multiple scripts, does the error handling properly prevent execution, or can this check be bypassed to run unintended bytecode? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: CompileScript::execute()] [Script Hash Collision] Can the script_hash calculation using HashValue::sha3_256_of be manipulated through malicious bytecode structure to produce hash collisions with legitimate scripts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: fix_bytecode_version()] [Version Inference Logic] Can the bytecode version inference from language_version be exploited to compile with incompatible versions that bypass security checks in the VM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/mod.rs] [Function: CompilePackage::execute()] [Dependency Resolution] In fetch_deps_only mode, can BuiltPackage::prepare_resolution_graph be tricked into resolving malicious dependencies from compromised git repositories? (Critical)
